intro: Tabernaemontana parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the eastern regions of Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with showy, often fragrant flowers. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that are typically star-shaped. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive blooms and tropical appearance. However, it is important to note that some species in this genus contain toxic compounds, so care should be taken when handling it.
